Reviews.Title: “Decent for penny-pinchers”
Reviews.Author: Djibuddha
Reviews.Content: For a hotel in Rome near Termini, this is an acceptable selction if you are trying to save money. The rooms are small, the bathrooms smaller (and need repairs!)! If you have issues with stairs, this is not your hotel. If you can handle stairs (even after all that walking during your visit!), go ahead and consider this place, though I would put it at the lower end of three stars. It's not... bad... it's just not great for the price - it's ok. Pros: price; location in relation to train, metro, and bus; fantastically friendly breakfast room attendant; windows that could be opened; the easier-to-clean things were very clean. Cons: rooms kept warm; small space (if you get a triple, you better be close and comfortable with your roommates!); friendly breakfast room attendant didn't always keep a sharp eye on clearing tables and stocking the counter; bathrooms need work (mildew, grouting).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: tinapalladino
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend traveled to Italy and spent two nights at the Hotel Select. There is no elevator in the hotel so I had asked the travel agent to request a ground floor room since my travel companion has difficulty climbing stairs. The hotel accommodated us for the two nights. I would highly recommend this hotel since it was clean and near the Termini station. Two of the staff (Armahd and Milena) were so helpful and took the time to answer our questions plus made us feel at home. This was my second time in Rome in less than two years for sightseeing and visiting family. Both of the hotel staff mentioned above could not have been more pleasant. Truly they are an asset to the hotel. What more can anyone ask for.

Reviews.Title: “strategic place and good service”
Reviews.Author: WindaPutri
Reviews.Content: the hotel is only 5 minutes walk from Termini Station. Good breakfast. The internet wi-fi worked very well with very reasonable price. The receptionist helped us much. The room is adequate and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not all hotels are created equal”
Reviews.Author: mona35
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel because the tour operater we used messed up our booking 4 days before we were to lleave for our family Christmas vacation. We had two rooms on the 3rd floor and hotel had no elevator. One of the room had no shower curtain and when asked for one the reply was " what do u want me to do about it!" Their idea of a continental breakfast was very poor, myhusband didn't mind the bed that felt like sleeping on wood plank but I did . The hotel was less then three blocks from the Trimini station which was nice but always crowded. The two older gentleman who man the desk are very nice and the lady who serves the continental breakfast also very nice. She made my husband a special morning pastry for he's birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTourist09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at the end of Sept. beginning of Oct. It is located close to Rome's main railway station - Termini. We used the express train direct from airport - the Leonardo Express, 15 euros each but if there is more than one of you it might be easier to get a cab - around 40 euro's. Rooms are smallish but adequate, we stored our suitcases on top of wardrobe. Everywhere is spotlessly clean, public areas, bedroom, bathroom. Towels were a good size and replaced daily. Shower always had plenty of hot water and good pressure. Hair dryer is fixed to wall and not that easy to use if you want to blow dry hair with a brush, I had taken my own and used that. The hotel advertised room safes but ours didn't work however staff were quick to offer to store items in hotel safe. In the end we locked things in our suitcase - laptops etc. We were not able to connect to wifi (cost is 3.50 euros for one hour) but other people had no difficulty. Close by there is a laundromatte where they will do your laundry for 9 euro's a load and you can use their fast computers for about 1;50 euros per hour. Breakfast buffet has rolls, danish, cheese, cold cuts, cereal, fruit (tinned),yogurt, juice coffee and tea. Milena (staff member) sets out breakfast each day and insisted on finding a tray and carrying our breakfasts outside into the lemon tree court for us. This was a beautiful place to eat breakfast and plan the day's activities. One day we came back from touring to find Milena had put 2 apples in our room for us! We found the room fairly quiet although you could hear someone snoring in another room one night. The room has a/c but it is not particlarly strong and since our room was on ground floor and glass door doubled as window we could not leave it open at night. Beds are pretty hard, at one point my husband was convinced that there was no mattress only a box spring but there was in fact a mattress and better too hard than too soft. The people on the desk were very helpful in giving directions to places we wanted to visit and in explaining how to buy metro tickets etc. We had a great week. There are limited restaurants in the area, not expensive but not amazing food either. We did use the Living room cafe/club several nights as they had free wifi and we could eat and do e mail etc. at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Decent spot, good value for a downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladytrooper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first night of our journey and the last two nights of our trip. The first night we had a decent size room on the interior of the hotel. It had a double bed and a twin bed. The bathroom was decent, however tub had no shower curtain, but wasn't a issue for me. Last two nights, we had a much smaller room, and the bathroom was very tiny, with mold in the shower. Room was on the road side, and heard trash trucks and street sweepers all night. So room location is important on whether or not I would recommend this hotel again. Staff was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “I will be staying there again in 2012”
Reviews.Author: TEMPEST555
Reviews.Content: I found Armando and his staff Giacomo, Milena, Roldan, Danili, Giovanni and Matthew of great service in the nearly 2 weeks I was there. This was my second stay at Hotel Select in Rome and the staff was very helpful with advice on where to go and to save a money when purchasing tickets. They are all very friendly, trustworthy and their English ranged from Excellent to Good. The early morning complimentary breakfast will meet your needs when starting the day. The hotel-at least where I was staying was quiet and the A/C was good enough to relieve you of the August heat you will experience in Rome. Termini station is less then a 10 minute walk from the hotel and the streets are well lit with various Italian Carbineri and Justice ministries nearby-so I felt safe at the early morning ours when I traveled the streets to Termini. Also nearby are commercial postage center I used successfully to mail a package, laundromat and Internet I intend to stay there again in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing find! We will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Brianna W
Reviews.Content: We absolutely adored Hotel Select! We arrived around 7pm and it is a very short walk from Termini train station. Do NOT pay for a cab ride unless you have a lot of cumbersome luggage, it is literally only 3 short blocks and the cabbies will charge you upwards of 20 euro! The hotel itself is small, but very comfortable. There is not very much space in the room, but we were there for sleeping only. The closet area is big enough to store suitcases, there is also a desk, flat screen TV, and much to our surprise, a mini fridge stocked with soda, water, and alcohol. We moved the mini bar items out and purchased our own items at a convenience store 1 block away. The bed was VERY comfortable and very clean. The bathroom was EXTREMELY spacious for European standards and included a bidet. The older gentleman at the front desk provided us with a city map and circled all of the "must-do" sites for our first visit to Rome. He also included helpful hints about taking the metro (don't board at Termini, avoid the crowds at the station and use the Republica station instead). All of the staff we encountered spoke English very well and greeted us with a smile at all times of day. Very warm and family-like. We traveled with our 4 year old son and we never once felt like we weren't welcome. Breakfast in the morning is very typical for Europe. Rolls, cheese, meat, pastry, cereal, yogurt. There are automatic coffee and juice machines. The coffee machine made a great cup and you could have several different types of coffee at the push of a button. The breakfast area was cozy and VERY clean. There is also a powder room adjacent to the breakfast area. The garden area is very simple. We did not use it, but we often saw several guests enjoying adrink at the outdoor tables. There is an indoor lounge room with books, Italy guides, and a full bar. Again, we did not order at the bar, but it was nice to have the option! Overall, it was a very centrally located, comfortable, clean, and friendly place to stay. We were very surprised with the "luxury" feel of the room. Rich woods, nice linens, and staff that actually cared! The 12pm check out is also nice. We will definitely be returning to Hotel Select on any future trips to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, comfortable and quaint.”
Reviews.Author: Traveleasy22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this quaint little hotel for 4 nights, on the first leg of our trip to Italy. We were with my son so we had a triple room, which was just enough but comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful at all hours, even when we arrived really late one night and found the door locked. We rang for the attendant to open the door for us and he greeted us kindly, no problem. The breakfast every morning was good. There was just enough of a variety to satisfy the three of us. Cereal, fruit and yogurt for my son. Toast and bread rolls with butter, a variety of jams and cheese for my husnband, and an assortment of breakfast danish with cappuccino for me. We were happy! Also, the person attending was such a lovely and friendly person. By the time we left we were good friends and sad to say good-bye! The location was really perfect for us. it was quiet yet close enough to the terminal to walk there and grab a bus to any place or take a 2-day tour bus, which was a great way to plan our daily excursions. We had an amazing time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “a very cute hotel with garden.”
Reviews.Author: NZsandras
Reviews.Content: Yes we loved this place and they were very friendly and helpful towards us new to Rome and Europe travel.Buffett breakfast was great and kept us going into afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful experience in everyway!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler60950
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an oasis in Rome. The manager, Armando and Milena (responsible for breakfast among other things) are wonderful, helpful and made our experience in Rome absolutely wonderful. Armando is knowledgeable, helpful and has a great sense of humor. We requested a quiet room facing the garden/courtyard and it was perfect....quiet and very comfortable. The bathrooms are a little "dated" but perfect adequate and very clean. We ate breakfast each morning in the garden and it was delightful. We had a wonderful stay in Rome thanks to Armando and Milena who went above and beyond to ensure that our visit was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: susanedee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing like it's pictures. No elevator, poor breakfast, cramped rooms and basically no garden. It needs fresh paint, wallpaper and updating desperately. Breakfast is in the basement! What a disappointment given the price. It may have a convenient location but Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: The2McDoos
Reviews.Content: Hotel Select Garden is just a few blocks from the main Roma train station, located on a side street with several other "garden" hotels. The front desk staff was just terrific and so helpful, although this is a good place to bring your Italian phrasebook and learn how to say "please repeat that more slowly" or ask them to write things down for you -- sometimes directions can be confusing. Our room was clean and neat with a nice window overlooking the garden/patio below. Hotel Select Garden has an enclosed solarium so that you can enjoy your breakfast inside or out. (We stayed inside to avoid the smokers on the outdoor patio.) The hotel also has a bar, although we didn't take advantage of that on this trip. WiFi is pay-by-the-hour and runs about the same as other hotels, but at Select Garden -- unlike other places we've stayed -- you can log out and save your minutes for later, which we appreciated. This hotel had the best breakfast we encountered on our two-week vacation, with a serve-yourself espresso-cappucino-American coffee machine, a nice selection of meat, cheese, fruit, yogurt, and delicious pastries. At least one guidebook states that this hotel has a laundry, which is not accurate. However, we were able to find a laundromat a few blocks away -- the Super Wash & Dry on Via Montebello. The proprietor is a super nice Bangladeshi gentleman who speaks excellent English and went out of his way to help us get our laundry done in time to make an early train.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Near the Train Station”
Reviews.Author: JRDEagan_Minnesota
Reviews.Content: I chose this place based on Trip Advisor reviews. The hotel is about four or five blocks from the Central Station, an easy walk. The rooms were adequate in size, and very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a nice garden and courtyard where breakfast is served. Make sure and ask for a room on the garden side, as the rooms facing the street can be pretty noisy at night, due to the general activity of the train station and the various night spots. Also, there is no elevator, so if you have trouble going up steps, try to get a room on the lower level. In summary, it is a good value, and convenient if you are traveling by train.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Service, Very Close to Termini Station, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Qualnurse
Reviews.Content: We spent the last 2 nights of our extended Italy vacation here and selected it primarily because of the price and the location close to Termini Station. We arrived from Florence with 3 large suitcases & did not want to hasste with cabs & such... and we made a good choice. The hotel is 3 streets over from the station, easy to find, and even with the bags was only about a 10 minute walk. Service was above average for a budget hotel - a doorman was available to carry our bags to the room (2nd level... hotel has no lift). Room was small but very comfortable. A very nice breakfast in a garden patio in the morning, wireless internet available but for a fee (I found it was cheaper to go to an internet point just down the street (1,50 euros for 1 hour... cheaper than the hotel). The quoted room rate was already very fair, but the owner/manager gave us a 20% discount for paying cash! They arranged a cab ride to the airport... so the service was great! I would not recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a "true" Roman immersion because it is not in the greatest part of town; however, it is very near the metro stop & bus station (and of course, the train station), so it is a good jumping-off point for anyone wanting to explore the city. Great value... good service. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: MummaH
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at Hotel Select our stay was excellent. We were greeted on our arrival by the cheerful and very welcoming concierge and made to feel extrememly comfortable. Our room was large and clean with a window. We had a full size bath with a shower above and toiletries were provided - which is extremely handy if you've been a little remiss when packing. Breakfast was very good with a selection of cereals, cold meats & cheese, rolls, croissants, melba toast, jams & honey, fruit, and tea, coffee & juices - ample selection to start your day and the lady that replenished the food was delightful. The actual location of the Hotel was great too - only minues from the station as well as the bus connections for touring the beautiful city of Rome. I will certainly recommend - and I hope we will be going back in the very near future. Thank you Hotel Select for making our stay a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice People, Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusTom
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome about 7:30 am and the Select Garden had a room available so we were allowed to check in early. Even allowed us to have breakfast upon arrival. Nice! We then had a little nap, showered and headed out for a full day and night of Rome. Hotel is not in middle of sights, but location near train station is great. Breakfast was very good. Great start to our Italian vacation.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel close to termini”
Reviews.Author: lonewolf1
Reviews.Content: my wife and I spend 5 days at hotel Select rooms where nice and clean bathroom a bit small but we didn't have any prolblems .We liked the location only 5 minute walk to Termini central staion , where you can get train,bus or metro to every place you like to go,wether you want to go inside or outside Rome. We loved Rome and since we like walking we walked to just about most of the major attaction all within 45minutes to 1 hour walk from the hotel .The staff spoke english and they were great, ready to help you any way they can.Breakfast was very good and delicious.We liked this hotel very much and when in Rome again this will be our hotel .Armando,Giorgio,Matthew and Ariana- thank you for everything

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: rob091
Reviews.Content: The hotel consists of two parts, most of the rooms are in the original building at the front but there is a row of rooms at the back boundary that open directly into a garden courtyard. We stayed in one of those, which are small but very comfortable. It is very relaxing to be able to sit outside in the courtyard and relax between excursions. The rooms in the main building are pretty ordinary; those at the front look out into the street, which is one of the least picturesque in Rome. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was basic but Ok . The location is convenient to the train station; it is far enough away to avoid the noise and bustle but it is not an attractive part of town. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. I would stay here again if I got the right room and at the right price, otherwise if you want to be near the train station then head to the other side closer to the Forum.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Billpat66
Reviews.Content: We arrived much earlier than check in time (9am), and were given a room, and they let us enjoy a free breakfest in thier lovely garden. The front desk was extremely helpful and friendly, and Melena at breakfast was as nice and friendly as any person you will meet in Rome. The location is no more than a 5 minute leisurely walk from the main Termini. We had no complaints and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Well placed and good accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Trevor0510
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Select for 4 nights. My room was off the garden where breakfast was served. It was small but with a comfortable bed and all the usual facilities. There was a buffet breakfast with a good selection of items. The staff were very helpful, the rooms very clean and also very quiet. The air conditioning was necessary with outside temperatures over 30C but unobstrusive. I needed to be near Roma Termini station and that was 5 minutes walk away as was the main bus station and sights such as Santa Maria Maggiore. I would certainly us it again

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to give it a higher rating, but...”
Reviews.Author: MightyMom2
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple, and the room was plenty big enough. We were right on the street, but it was amazingly quiet, even though it was just a half a block from a busy street. The breakfast room and garden are quite pretty. We ended up eating inside each day, as bees swarmed our food as soon as we sat down outside the first day. Other people didn't have that problem. The breakfast lady was extremely helpful with giving directions and telling us which buses to take and where the supermarket was. The front desk staff were also very friendly. The location is good, with easy access to Termini and another metro station. The reasons I can't give it a higher rating are the air conditioning, hair dryer, bathroom and breakfast. The air conditioning blew all night, but the air was never cold coming out of it, so it never got below 80 degrees. It didn't matter what you put the thermostat on. There were too many mosquitos to open the windows, so we just suffered in the heat and humidity. The hair dryer was like a vacuum hose and attachment that had no air pressure. You had to pull it out from the wall to get it to come on and therefore had to stand over the bidet where there was no mirror in order to keep the air blowing. The bathroom was pretty small, with no counter space. There was no shower curtain in the tub, so the floor got soaked. The breakfast was just okay...the usual continental breakfast that we got everywhere. However, there was no fresh fruit, just canned fruit cocktail. We visited 5 other hotels on our trip, and were able to get fresh fruit and hard-boiled eggs at all of the other hotels. Concluding, I would recommend this hotel if you don't care as much about the four things I complained about. We paid about $150 per night, which is pretty good for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location with really nice service!”
Reviews.Author: nick6feet10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Termini station yet remains nice and quiet. We found the staff to be very friendly and informative (though we did deal with them strictly in italian). The breakfast provided was excellent and of good quality. Overall the value was very good. We will definitely stay at this hotel again whenever we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Transfer”
Reviews.Author: jeva042
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Select online, and when I arrived there had been some problems with power, resulting in my hotel room being unavailable. Luckily for me, the helpful staff booked me in at Hotel Europa down the street - it was a quick and painless transfer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: dhedric1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice if you are primarily staying there as a place to sleep. Rooms were quite small but nice. Hotel staff was very accomidating and is also very close to Termini. If you plan on traveling by train or metro at all I would highly reccomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: MelandMatt2010
Reviews.Content: We loved our time at the Hotel Select. My husband and I stayed there for 4 days at the end of our 2 week vacation in Rome. My in laws stayed as well. Armando, the manager, gave us a special 3 person room on the first floor and it was wonderful and spacious. I was surprised how large it was. My in laws stayed on the second floor their first night. It was more typical of the small Italian hotel rooms were were expecting. The following day, Armando moved them to a 1st floor garden room. It was a little larger and right off the garden courtyard. They loved the rom because it sheltered them from the noise of the street Hotel Select resides on. The breakfasts were very filling and I loved the cappuccinos that were made to order every day. The broiche was brought in fresh every morning as well. The hotel was clean and everything was in working order. It was nice to have CNN World News channel. The only thing I noticed was our room had a slight smoke smell. I am assuming at one time the hotel allowed smoking in the rooms. I only noticed the slight smell when i walked into the room but it was not overpowering. All in all we had an excellent stay and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: cbesch47
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very friendly nice place to stay near termini. The only downfall are the beds. I wish they would upgrad to softer beds. They were like sleeping on concrete. Other than that the rooms were very clean, the staff was great. The breakfast was adequate. The lovely lady that worked the breakfast was one of the nicest friendliest people I have meant. She went out of her way to help. Hotel staff was friendly and would help you in any way they could. They contactd a private van to take us to the airport as we did not want to walk in the heat with our luggage the termini. They knew exactly who to contact and it only costs us 25 euros more than the train would have. I will have to say the bathroom was exceptionally small too. For big American like my husband (6-4 & 200) he had a difficult time in the shower. But it was a nice quiet place to stay. If you want to save money and have a clean place to stay I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Solo Traveller”
Reviews.Author: NDSydney56
Reviews.Content: I stayed there May 19th - 24th for 5 nights and found the hotel close to the Termini station, in a quiet street. Room small on the 1st level but I excepted it as I was told they are not very big if I get a single room which I thought was good value for the money, I was out all of the day and only slept there so it didn't bother me that it was small. Very clean, most of the staff very friendly in paricularly Armando on the desk and Milena in the breakfast room. Big garden breakfast area with basic continental breakfast. There is a supermarket nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the train station, really really small room”
Reviews.Author: dctraveler1818
Reviews.Content: I am very familiar with European rooms- this was by far the smallest I'dve ever stayed in. Closed suitcases fit on either side of the bed (which was really hard) and you had to get in from the foot of the bed. Shower door didn't open all the way because it hit the toilette. The whole building's tempurature was set to 78*F and it was 90* outside. Way too hot. We opened the window which cooled down the room, but let in all the light and noise in the morning. Won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Lienkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Select Garden Hotel in Rome in December 2008 and were pleasantly surprised about the quality of service that the 3star hotel offered. We went straight from the airport and arrived early in the morning, long before check-in time. Once we got there they immediately told us that we can have an extra free breakfast while they clean up a room for us so that we can refresh from our long flight and we did not even ask. The breakfast is absolutely great and there is a lot of variety. When we were finished with our breakfast our heavy suitcases were already waiting for us in our clean room. We also had to change some of our trip plans with other hotels in Florence and Milan and they offered to help us with all the phone calls and searching free of charge... it saved us from a lot of headache. Friendly and Helpful is what you need in a foreign country! I would definitely recommend this hotel... it is near the main metro and bus station that can take you anywhere you want to be in Rome! I wish to return myself.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable small hotel with very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: chriswwh
Reviews.Content: Small city centre hotel with courtyard garden, breakfast room and bar. Stayed for 10 days. Rooms small and some road noise but very clean and tidy with comfortable beds. Courtyard rooms have very small bathrooms. However, staff were amazingly helpful including the cleaners, the lady who presided over the very good breakfast, the front desk staff and the manager. Our stay was extended from an original 4 days by the volcanic erruption. The manager helped us get detals of flight cancellations, waived telephone costs and gave us a 30% discount on our room for our extended stay even though he was turning stranded travellers away as the hotel was full. Thought hotel was just right for us as Rome was so fascinating that we only needed a friendly comfortable base to sleep and eat breakfast - the rest of the time we were exploring the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jrios30
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for about a week and a half and the staff was very helpful in helping us find good resteraunts to eat at and getting around town. And the woman who hosts the free continental breakfast was also very friendly and a pleasure to talk to. The rooms were cleaned and our beds made everyday and our request for extra pillows and such was promptly fullfilled. Rooms were not that big though. But staff definitely made for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a very good breakfast & an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dushyantmani
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets 3 stars automatically for its location, sandwiched between the Termini station & the central bus stop and easily accessible by foot. We stayed here for 3 nights during our Rome-Florence-Venice trip last year and really enjoyed the hospitality of the staff. Rooms are small in size but then it's Europe, eh! A garden dining area made the experience all the more pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast room very bery good”
Reviews.Author: Adam_in_Oz
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, and conveniently located close to the Termini, but the 1 thing I remember most of all was that the coffee machine in the breakfast room gave me hands-down the best coffee I had in all of Italy. This is not a put-down of Italian coffee - the coffee machine was just unbelievably good. I drank more coffee at hotel Select than I did anywhere else (probably combined).

Reviews.Title: “don't miss breakfast in the garden!”
Reviews.Author: matt_trav
Reviews.Content: this hotel was very close to the train station, but a bit further from the center center that we would have like to, but this didn't affect our stay, staff was nice, rooms comfortable, and above all i'd like to enhance their breakfast in that little garden/courtyard, so very typical mediterranean, a very nice experience

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Price, Great Location, Great Staff, Last Minute”
Reviews.Author: here_we_go_2009
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a very good experience with this hotel. We stayed there for four nights at the end of a couple week trip around Europe. We found this hotel last minute on TripAdvisor (two days before we stayed there) while in Europe. The location was very convenient to all of Rome's public transportation as it was about three short blocks from Termini, Rome's main underground stop and train station (where you can catch an express train to Rome's airport 30min. away). The breakfast was included and was filling and quite decent though nothing special. It was served in a lovely courtyard. The staff was quite good overall and the concierges spoke very good English. The day concierge was wonderful, extremely helpful with answering both questions we asked and offering useful information we hadn't thought to ask about. The night concierge was nice enough but I wouldn't leave your key with the front desk like they want (we always kept ours with us) if you are planning to come back late as we came back one evening and the night concierge had stepped out to talk to someone or for a smoke and had left a line of keys out on the desk, I assume so people could get back into their rooms if they returned while he was out. Other than that I felt quite safe there and I'm pretty security conscious. The room was small, though I believe that for a budget hotel in the middle of a major city, it could have been far worse. The bathroom was tiny. I mean really tiny, however it was sufficient for needs. To us the bidet seemed an extra waste of space in a place that was already super cramped, however I realize some people won't choose to stay somewhere that doesn't have one. My main problem with the hotel was that along with the shower being incredibly cramped, it was also very mildewed which seems like a fairly simple problem to fix. Other than the mildew in the shower everything else seemed very clean and the maid was on top of replacing anything in the bathroom that was running low (soap, toilet paper). Again, my overall impression of the place was very good and without the mildew I wouldn't have any complaints considering the reasonable rates this place offers compared to many others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money paid, friendly, clean and well situated for sight seeing.”
Reviews.Author: Sunell
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Select was close to main Roma Termini, tour buses also run from there and are well worth using. Metro very good for getting about only 1 euro a trip. Did not find any public toilets about, although the fountains are good for filling your water bottles and perfectly ok to drink. Spanish steps a must see, we visited in the evening, lovely atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelilngs about this little gem”
Reviews.Author: nelson1610
Reviews.Content: the Hotel Select Garden is a little gem among the high priced and low-priced fleabags that are your options in Rome. The staff is great. Extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is adequate - fruit cocktail (like the stuff from a can that my mom used to put in jello mold) and other odd choices, but it's enough to get a start on the day. But my biggest complaint is about my room, which unfortunately is what makes up 90% of a hotel experience. Traveling alone, I suppose I can't be greedy, but I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and you would think that would count for something. I was given a "quiet room off the garden". Well, first it isn't quiet when there are people sitting in the garden talking, which of course they do at breakfast and also sometimes late at night. Also, I am a non-smoker, and the garden is where people smoke, so I had to keep my one source of fresh air - the door to my room, closed whenever there were people there. My room was about the size of a walk-in closet, which was okay. The bathroom was also small. Had to back in to sit on the toilet. That was fine too. It was all very functional and adequate. But the safe did not work, my refrigerator was warm and mid-way during my trip my air-conditioner stopped working. It wasn't super hot when I was in Rome - late Sept./early Oct., but since I had to keep my door closed to keep out the noise, smoke and also mosquitoes, it got quite warm. I asked at the desk if they could fix it and supposedly they were going to do something, but it was not fixed. The location was great for me - very near Termini station which was the best place to get any bus or metro, and also since it was the terminus point, you didn't need to know the bus you needed to get home, just stand at a bus stop and look for a bus that said Statzione Termini and hop on. If my air-con, refrigerator and safe worked, I would have given this hotel 5 stars, but unfortunately, there are certain things that can make or break a hotel stay and for me these definitely affected the quality of my trip. Oh, one more thing - they do have wifi, but you have to pay extra.

Reviews.Title: “I shall return”
Reviews.Author: TEMPEST555
Reviews.Content: I had a marvelous stay at Hotel Select. Armando and Alex was really helpful and friendly and insured all my needs were met, Max gave me the 'keys to the city' by explaining to me the transportation bus/train system (Hot tip: use the 'Roma Pass'), Milena was very helpful and friendly and helped me with some Italian during my breakfast. Hotel Select is as others posted is so close (3 blocks) to Termini Station, laundromats/INTERNET centers, fine little street cafes/restaurants you really can't miss staying there. You can "VIRTUALLY WALK' to the Hotel Select entrance using the street level on Google Map from Termini Station! You do not need a taxi or bus to get there-just a short, safe walk. Use the Google Street level-you'll see. :^) The hotel rooms are clean, the Continental breakfast is good enough to get you through to dinner and the street is quiet. Yes the rooms are small-but I stayed there 2 weeks and I was exploring Italy not sitting in my room. A clean room, a clean sheets, a clean bathroom and a friendly & knowledgeable staffs awaits you at the end of your day. There is a small courtyard where you can sit and play cards or enjoy a drink with your friends. I miss the people I met there and look forward to see them next year when I return to Rome. Fino all'anno prossimo i miei amici. Ho avuto un volo molto lungo prendere la strada di seta di nuovo all'Hawai. Ma la ha valsa perché avete reso la mia chiamata memorabile.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Select had a Homely atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Hashmumbai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Termini station.The staff was very helpful. Mr. Armando was a very nice person. always willing to help and guide. The breakfast was served in a courtyard and was very satisfying. Milena was very warm and helpful too. On the whole, we had a pleasant stay and would definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy178
Reviews.Content: Hotel Select was comfortable with a good breakfast buffet and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Good location but the rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: Jasarm
Reviews.Content: Located 5 blocks from the Rome train station on a quiet side street. makes it easy to get around Rome as two sub way lines also meet at the train station. This was a big plus as we wew travelling around Italy by train and the subway has stops near many of the main tourist sites. It was very easy to get to and from. The staff was friendly. There is a very good continental breakfast served in a a nice rear courtyard. Located near by are some decent reasonably priced restaurants. My only knock is that the room is small. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: toby452
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel near the main train station in a quiet neighborhood with good restaurants. Close enough to all of the sight seeing stops. All the busses line up out side the main train terminal. Everyone is friendly and helpful. The breakfast is served in a pleasant garden. Even though it says continental it is a full breakfast to me. Their view of continental is different from the USA. The hotel room was clean and an ok size for the price which was good on the pocketbook. 2 Blocks away they have a combination laundry mat and internet. Where you can use the internet 15 minutes for 50 cents to 1 euro for ½ hr. and they do your laundry for you for a cheap price..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Holiday Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coffeandcream
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. The room we were show to was situated in the garden area, and was clean and tidy. It also had air conditioning which is a must. The en-suite was a bit small, but adequate. The breakfast buffet had an excellent choice of food, friut juice and hot drinks. The hotel was situated close to the termini station and bus station. The local shops and restaurants were only a walk away.The best thing about the hotel was the staff. They were so friendly and helpful and we will miss them. North Wales

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, helpful staff but no elevator!”
Reviews.Author: DeefromFremont
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about the staff, the cleanliness of the hotel, the comfort of the beds. However, the room my grandson and I were given was on the top floor and there were more than sixty steps to climb to reach it. After a long day exploring the city it was just too much. I found it hard to believe there was no lift in a three star hotel. The rooms are a little small, but I thought reasonable for the price. Breakfast (my grandson called it breadfast) was minimal, but the surroundings were pleasant. Because most of my friends are my age, I would not recommend the hotel unless they could be guaranteed a ground floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DrDweeb
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews here, I booked 4 nights with my gf. Perfectly located, easy walking access to Termini and local supermarkets and restaurants. There seemed to be about 7 different receptionists working there, each as helpful as the other. My gf's luggage did not arrive with her, and the hotel made the necessary phone calls for us and received the luggage in our absence. They also were helpful calling venues for ticket information. Breakfast was a bit boring by the second day, but it is pleantiful with fresh youghurt, coffee, juices, bread and pastries, cereals, fruit and müselli, cheese, ham,. salami. When the automatic coffee machine was non-operational, someone was making real espressos for us. No complaints whatsoever. The reception has a computer with internet in the cramped receptionist's space, and they allowed me access to get my email etc. They also allowed me to connect my netbook via ethernet cable when I needed VPN access. WiFi is installed but not yet operational, so that negative will disappear in time. I guess the only negative was that the rooms are not as soundproof as one would like. I think mentioned by another reviewer as well. Small, but comfortable, with a mini-bar fridge that had plenty of space for my own purchases from the supermarket. I hate overstocked mini-bars with no space. So, overall, the Hotel Select was an oasis of service, in the disaster zone that is Rome. Hint: Don't eat at Florians on the square - it is everything the Hotel Select is not. Overpriced, slow, grumpy service with food of average quality. Head around the block to some cheaper, far better eateries if you need a quick meal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Outstanding Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: zinz182
Reviews.Content: I walked into this hotel with no reservation, needing a place to stay after the hotel i had booked previously didnt work out. the gentleman at the front desk was extremely understanding and helpful, and showed me their available room; a lovely double on the garden. i took it gladly, and for my two night stay, i was met with the most attentive service ive experienced at any hotel- budget, middle class, or otherwise. this is not a five star hotel, but the rooms are airconditioned, and have CNN in english on the tv (which was appreciated after 2 weeks traveling around europe). the location cant be beat, and you can get buses to any and all of the attractions just around the corner. in fact, the gentleman at the front desk personally walked me to the bus stop and showed me which bus to get on. this was greatly appreciated. i will certainly stay here on my next trip to rome, and i highly recommend that you do too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely littl Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dom20
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in this charming little hotel just a few minutes walk from Termini. The little courtyard garden with a Lemon Tree was very lovely - as was the breakfast room looking out onto it. Breakfast was included and was continenal in style, with more that enough to eat. The staff were very welcoming and curtious. The rooms were clean, and well appointed. The only downside I think was that the bathrooms were a bit small - at least in the rooms in the Garden where we stayed. But very happy to return!

Reviews.Title: “loved rome..on par with egypt! lovely hotel..”
Reviews.Author: mattmanireland
Reviews.Content: I read some people saying the rooms were small. Well no, they are not that small (for that price – we got it for 52 euro a room a night). Rooms were nice and tidy, tv, fridge, nice clean toilet. Only thing here is, the shower is very small to fit into. I’m not a big person, and I was bumping my elbows off the walls! Location. 4 mins walk from main terminal station , which is about 2.8K from city centre. Just find the main entrance to terminal station, go straight up, about the 4th left, at nearly end of street. A taxi to centre is about 6-14 euros (more expensive at night), but watch them as they tend to add extras. The staff are first class. Very helpful. Would go out of the way to give you a helping hand. I was in room 222, which was on main street. So it can be noisy , in the morning. But overall for a bunch of friends , its great value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel select is a great experience for travelers.”
Reviews.Author: Romantic757
Reviews.Content: The hotel select is conveniently located near the main train station in Rome.The staff was very helpful with directions and sight seeing information.One staff member named Armando was exceptional attentive and pleasant.The hotel is clean and well maintained.The tone of the hotel is peaceful and quiet.This hotel would not be suited to party goers or spring break types.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly stuff”
Reviews.Author: travelEMEA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room one night. One of the staff, Armendo, is exceptionally friendly and helpful. Although the room is very small, I'd say he made my stay pleasant!.....Thank you. Grazie. Regards, Karen

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for BUdget Travellers”
Reviews.Author: AMARKAMPANI
Reviews.Content: In case any one is travelling on a budget this place is real good...clean and with all modern amenities in the room.Breakfast is good and the staff is awesomely helpful including the lady at the breakfast counter and Frederick at the reception!Enjoy Rome by staying here

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Rome center”
Reviews.Author: mogens
Reviews.Content: Hotel Select Garden is a nice, silent, clean and friendly hotel near Termini (5 mins). We stayed 7 nights and enjoyed the stay. Highly recomended. Only minus was the size of the room ...

Reviews.Title: “Cute little place”
Reviews.Author: Summertime-FL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first two nights in Rome and really have no complaints. It was nice & quiet (we had a courtyard room), staff was very friendly and helped anyway they could! Rooms were small which was expected, breakfast in the morning was just enough to get us through till lunch. Sliced meats/cheese, ext. They did make cappuccino’s so that was an added bonus! There is no elevator just stairs! I didn't mind the first night but after two days of walking EVERYWHERE in Rome going up 3 flights of stairs after a long day was no fun!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Rome experience”
Reviews.Author: jessmead
Reviews.Content: This was the first place we stayed in Italy, and it was great. Though we got a room in the front of the building, and it was a little noisy, it was actually a really decent size. The staff were very very friendly and the courtyard/garden was gorgeous for a complimentary continental breakfast and cappuccino! Great location, so so close to the train station, and in the heart of Rome, within walking distance of everything. This hotel had the great charm of Italy, friendliness and comfort all in one. Loved it, and would go back for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jaspat
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel which offers value for money. The room was small, and the en suite had a very small shower and no bath. The room was very clean and towels etc changed daily. Breakfast was OK, nothing great but fairly typical for continental breakfast. Could take this indoors or outside in a pretty patio area. The best features are its location (Close to Termini), and the very friendly and helpful staff. Happy for luggage to be left there and collected later.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms-OK for citytrip”
Reviews.Author: ferox
Reviews.Content: Elementary comfort – Verry small room and bathroom (We had room 222) . friendly staff –Good breakfast Advice: ask room in the back, it is more quite Hotel is 5 min walk from Termini

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms . very good value”
Reviews.Author: launz
Reviews.Content: Almost totally renovated hotel in an old building with a court/garden . Elementary comfort (No lift) and the smallest room i have ever seen (The very comfortable king size bed occupied 90% of the room surface . Room was really higher than large ). Tiny clean and nice bathroom . Good breakfast in the court . Quite friendly staff . Good location 3 minutes away from termini station (trains , metro , buses to the airports , local buses ) in a quiet , safe street . I got all this for 71 € by internet . I think this is an unbeatable value .

Reviews.Title: “Lots for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for six nights at Hotel Select (Via Bachelet) which is within walking distance of the main train station (Termini). We paid only $537 for the week in mid March. It is located in a very nice area and is close to restaurants and sightseeing. The best part was the breakfast where the buffet included a coffee maker where you could press a button and get any kind of specialty coffee and as much as you wanted! The array of sweet rolls, cereals, meats, cheeses, juices and yogurt was impressive. The bed room had a nice size window which you could open and look out onto the street. The bed was comfy and the sheets were ironed! The manager was very nice, even checking our train and hotel reservations in Florence for us. There is a private patio area in the back and a soon to be sun-room. We would love to stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Select Garden
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vittorio Bachelet 6, 00185 Rome, Italy
